snippet: Massachusetts will be the first state to try to cap overall health care spending, both private and public, so that it will grow no faster than the state economy.
abstract: Editorial applauds Massachusetts for passing a bill that will try to cap overall health care spending, the first such bill in the nation; questions whether the plan is bold enough to succeed; contends that regardless of the result, the plan will offer valuable lessons to the rest of the country.
lead_paragraph: Massachusetts will be the first state to try to cap overall health care spending, both private and public, so that it will grow no faster than the state economy.
